fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46793].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Confluence Question summary window does not display special characters

h3. Environment
Cloud - Confluence 1000.842.2
Questions for Confluence Plugin Version:
1000.0.0-D20161205T033509

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open questions in Confluence
# Have a question which contains ' or other special characters.
# Search for questions in summary.

h3. Expected Results
The list should be displayed with the questions and no errors.

h3. Actual Results
 !Screen Shot 2017-01-13 at 1.36.33 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes 
May be related to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CQ-2123

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46789].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

In some cases, trying to upload an attachment to an answer or comment in CQ results in this error:
!error.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click 'Questions' in the top menu
# Select a question (or create one, if none exists)
# Under 'Your answer' select the 'Insert Image' button
# Drag and drop any file
# The error will appear

h3. Expected Results
Attachment is added.

h3. Actual Results
It fails with this error:
{noformat}
No content found.
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
None so far

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46777].
  {panel}

h2. Steps to reproduce

1. Answer a question
2. (An email notification will be generated)
3. Convert the answer to a comment
4. Click the link to view the content from the notification from Step 2.
5. Attempt to add a new comment

h2. Expected Behaviour

The editor loads and allows me to add a comment

h2. Actual Behaviour

The editor does not finish loading. Additionally, the follow JavaScript error is reported to the console when the page loads:

{noformat}
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'scrollIntoView' of undefined
{noformat}

h2. Workaround

Modify the request URL to remove the reference to the offending piece of content.  For example, if the URL you clicked was:
* [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/38397449/answers/38505072]

Try this URL instead:
* [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/38397449]
fields.summary: Quick comment editor does not load when request URL contains a permalink to an answer which was converted to a comment
Sharing a Confluence Question doesn't produce a workbox notification

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46773].
  {panel}

Hi Dennis and Jeremy,

I've spoken to each of you independently over the course of the past few weeks to discuss changes needed in AAC as part of the Brand Amplification effort led by Ken Olofsen. I'd like to connect to make sure we have the right level of attention on the changes being made in AAC, apologies if its overkill.

On July 22, 2013 GreenHopper and Bonfire will effectively be renamed to JIRA Agile Planner and JIRA Agile Tester to amplify the JIRA brand. This decision was made by Ken and the Executive Team some time ago. Ken is relying on the "asset owners" of various different systems to make the changes that reflect the decisions made around Brand Amplification.

To ensure that all of the details of this change are covered I've created a list of detailed tasks in ServiceDog. 

These tasks include:
1. (/) For every question that is already tagged as "greenhopper", add a new tag "jira-agile"
2. (/) For every question that is already tagged as "bonfire", add a new tag "jira-capture"
3. (/) Rename "GreenHopper" to "JIRA Agile" on the Ask a Question tag wizard
4. (/) Rename "Bonfire" to "JIRA Capture" on the Ask  a Question tag wizard
5. (/) Remove "JIRA Agile" from the top-level Ask a Question tag row, and move to the second level
6. (x) Rename "Bonfire" to "JIRA Capture" on the Answers Leaderboard - *Bonfire has been replaced with Stash on the Leaderboard*
7. (x) Rename "GreenHopper" to "JIRA Agile" on the Answers Leaderboard - *GreenHopper has been replaced with Crowd on the Leaderboard*
8. (/) Rename GreenHopper product badges to JIRA Agile.
9. (/) Remove GreenHopper logo on product badges, add JIRA logo.

Please take a look at the above tasks and identify any potential dependencies or complications with those stated above that might hinder us from hitting the July 22, 2013 go-live date. 

I have a status tracker for the Brand Amplification project listed here: https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/SUPPORT/Bramplification+Status+Tracker

You can use the status tracker to identify any blockers and/or articulate your status.

Thanks,
Alex

fields.summary: related questions still slow
The recent activity tab tells me I've lost karma and I don't know why

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46764].
  {panel}

When cancelling the bounty on:

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/68424/greenhopper-chart-board-how-do-i-programmatically-grab-the-current-day-s-delta-vs-planned

...I got a unexpected download dialog for a file called "cancel" and the pop-up didn't draw right.

It looks like the bounty actually got cancelled.
fields.summary: AAC has JS Bug When Cancelling Bounty
Is it possible to have a field to add watchers while creating ticket?

fields.summary: 500 error after setup JIRA Agile
Unable to post a question on the forums once i log in.
Not being notified when someone answers my questions
Non-admin users can edit topics and mark as featured
Issues do not appear on Kanban rapidboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46740].
  {panel}

The existing filter is very problematic for us because it means people may have answered on a question and yet the problem hasn't been dealt with. By being able to filter by this it means we can deal with outstanding issues easier. The current filter doesn't help us, unfortunately.

The filter just needs to be called something like 'Unresolved' or something. In fact the current filter doesn't make sense, the question might not be answered just because there's answers on the question, they have to be accepted in order to be a valid answer.

It would save us a huge ton of time and also make sure we deal with all customers appropriately.

Cheers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46732].
  {panel}

The XSS vulnerability is only present in some parts of the UI where the username is incorrectly marked as "safe" for HTML output.

Known vulnerability points:
* When viewing a user's activity stream on their profile page
* When viewing the site-wide activity stream in the Administrative UI

This vulnerability was introduced when Atlassian ID was integrated with Answers. Previously, local-based user accounts had their usernames scrubbed before saving in the database.
fields.summary: Persistent XSS in Username field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46731].
  {panel}

See the attached stack trace - you can follow the stack frames to see how the infinite recursion can occur.

It happens because CommentPermissionDelegate in CQ causes the comment body to be rendered when checking view permission. This can cause an infinite loop if the comment body contains a link to an attachment on the comment.  Because the renderer will check if the user has view permission on the attachment before showing the link, which causes the view permission of the attachment's container to be checked, which causes the permission to be checked on the comment. And now we are in a loop where checking the view permission on the comment causes the body to be rendered again.

I'm not sure how we ended up in this situation, because if you test on a clean/vanilla instance of Confluence Questions, new attachments are added to the parent question entity; I can't see any way in which attachments get associated with the comment entity - so in other CQ instances it seems that it would be difficult to trigger this behaviour.

Despite this, there is still a logical flaw in the permission checking logic for comments which should be guarded against.  Now that comments have a rich text body, checking the permission on the comment should avoid performing a full render of its content.
fields.summary: Infinite loop leads to stack overflow when rendering a comment that contains an embedded hyperlink to an attachment which is contained by the same comment entity

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46728].
  {panel}

[https://answers.atlassian.com/api/users/1/] should return information for the User with ID=1 (that's Jeremy).  However, that is currently not the case:

{noformat}
{
    "username": "1", 
    "website": "", 
    "about": "", 
    "links": {
        "badges": "/users/1/badges", 
        "self": "/users/1", 
        "questions": "/users/1/questions", 
        "answers": "/users/1/answers"
    }, 
    "tags": [], 
    "organisation": "1", 
    "answers": 0, 
    "id": 56120, 
    "karma": 1, 
    "questions": 0, 
    "following": false, 
    "last_seen": "2013-06-10 10:36:08", 
    "date_joined": "2013-06-10 10:36:08", 
    "email": "dirk@d-tt.nl", 
    "badges": 0, 
    "location": ""
}
{noformat}

The API code appears to be doing a look-up by username instead of by User ID, as this result is the user with a username of "1".

This will probably have many negative consequences, but most notably this breaks the user hover for Jeremy's account.

Question = https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/57471/would-a-new-installation-of-an-older-version-of-fisheye-one-that-supports-ibm-clearcase-be-available

This question has 2 answers.
The 1st answer from someone else shows a green check to indicate it was accepted.
I added a 2nd answer, which shows no check, so it looks like it was not accepted.

However, my Karma History shows that my answer on this question was accepted on May 24th.
Looking at the author's Recent Activity shows that he accepted both answers on May 24th.

I know that multiple answers can be accepted, see e.g. https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/247/should-we-use-answers-atlassian-com-instead-of-forums-atlassian-com, so as far as I can see my answer should also show a green check.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46714].
  {panel}

Using this commit: https://bitbucket.org/DennisKvdM/answers_redesign/commits/40168ef16b07a763a3ce4d27ff14d9d8d16dfcf6

h5. Answering a question with a product tag and no bounty does not show on *product* leaderboard
* Log in as user 'nriley'
* Ask a Question > Add tag 'jira' > NO bounty > Submit
* Log out > Log in as user 'Andrew Rowls'
* Answer question asked by 'nriley'
* Log out > Log in as user 'nriley'
* Accept answer by user 'Andrew Rowls' > Navigate to 'All' Leaderboard 
** Expected Behavior: User 'Andrew Rowls' should appear on Weekly & Monthly leaderboard with 25 karma
** Actual Behavior: User 'Andrew Rowls' appears on Weekly & Monthly leaderboard
** *WORKING*
* Navigate to 'Jira' leaderboard
** Expected Behavior: User 'Andrew Rowls' should appear on Weekly & Monthly leaderboard with 25 karma
** Actual Behavior: User 'Andrew Rowls' does not appear on Weekly & Monthly leaderboard
** {color:red}FAILS{color}

h5. Answering a question with a product tag and a bounty shows the bounty amount only on *product* leaderboard
* Log in as user 'nriley'
* Ask a Question > Add tag 'jira' > add 25 karma bounty > Submit
* Log out > Log in as user 'Andrew Rowls'
* Answer question asked by 'nriley'
* Log out > Log in as user 'nriley'
* Accept answer by user 'Andrew Rowls' > Navigate to 'All' Leaderboard 
** Expected Behavior: User 'Andrew Rowls' should appear on Weekly & Monthly leaderboard with 50 additional karma
** Actual Behavior: User 'Andrew Rowls' appears on Weekly & Monthly leaderboard with 50 additional karma (75 in total)
** *WORKING*
* Navigate to 'Jira' leaderboard
** Expected Behavior: User 'Andrew Rowls' should appear on Weekly & Monthly leaderboard with 50 additional karma
** Actual Behavior: User 'Andrew Rowls' appears on Weekly & Monthly leaderboard with 25 karma - *the amount of the bounty alone*
** {color:red}FAILS{color}

[See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46694]. {panel} This is an AAC error being thrown from too many tags being added by the SAC connector. It's this part: u'tags': u'ondemand preview edit keystroke textentry keyboard textbox macro', u'title': u'Confluence OnDemand unable to edit macro fields after "preview >", I suppose we need some sort of validation for cross-posting? No session, /api/login first. else: return rc.BAD_REQUEST # Did not include session data. clean_tags = TagNamesField(user=userObj).clean tags = '' if data.get('tags'): tags = clean_tags(data['tags']) ... if id: #Updates are fscking difficult. q = self.model.objects.get(id=id) q.process_data(text=data.get("body"), title=data.get("title"), tags=tags) return rc.ALL_OK #Update else: #Create the question (AskAction) actor = forum.actions.AskAction(user=author) ▶ Local vars Variable Value args () author clean_tags > data {u'body': u"

Issue exists in the following two browsers I have installed.

Chrome 18.0.1025.162 m

FF 11 - Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:11.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/11.0

User Prefs: Keyboard shortcuts: Enabled (screenshot attached)

Steps to reproduce:

1. Create new Confluence page

2. Insert Code Block macro (however this bug appears to affect all)

3. Set Title field and select Insert

4. Click button to Preview >

5. Return to editing by clicking < Edit

6. Click the macro's title border and select Edit from the menu

7. Click the text entry box for the Title and attempt to change the text or create new text. my cursor appears in the text entry box, however keyboard input does not appear to work into the field. This is the case for previously populated (changing) and attempting to populate an empty field. First line number if you followed along above.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46693]. {panel} Traceback (most recent call last): File "/opt/python/domains/atlassian.com/answers/lib/python2.6/site-packages/django/core/handlers/base.py", line 100, in get_response response = callback(request, *callback_args, **callback_kwargs) File "/opt/python/domains/atlassian.com/answers/ADM-19495/forum/modules/decorators.py", line 95, in decorated return decoratable(*args, **kwargs) File "/opt/python/domains/atlassian.com/answers/ADM-19495/forum/modules/decorators.py", line 55, in __call__ res = self._callable(*args, **kwargs) File "/opt/python/domains/atlassian.com/answers/ADM-19495/forum/modules/decorators.py", line 30, in self._callable = lambda *args, **kwargs: fn(origin, *args, **kwargs) File "/opt/python/domains/atlassian.com/answers/ADM-19495/forum_modules/akismet/startup.py", line 106, in wrapper if not api.comment_check(comment, data.copy()): File "/opt/python/domains/atlassian.com/answers/ADM-19495/forum_modules/akismet/lib/akismet.py", line 331, in comment_check raise AkismetError('missing required argument.') AkismetError: missing required argument. , POST:Hi Guys,

\r\n

Gorzan, this was a Chrome bug that should have been fixed in 4.0.5 as per https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-23234,

\r\n

Can you just confirm that\'s the version you\'re on? If it is, can you also try doing it on http://confluence.atlassian.com which is running 4.1 - just find any page and start a comment and test it there then cancel it. I\'d be interested to see how you go with that.

\r\n

Jason, as you\'d gather, if you\'re on 4.0 you\'ll be hitting the bug, an upgrade should fix it. You might also like to test out 4.1 onhttp://confluence.atlassian.com

\r\n

Thanks,

\r\n

John

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46691].
  {panel}

Steps:
1. From EAC, navigate to CQ dashboard and click on on any tabs: 'Popular', 'Recent', 'Unanswered'. 
2. Scroll to the end of page to load more questions, scroll until you could not see the indicator.

Actual result:
Only next 15 questions can be loaded for first time.
'Show more' link does not show at the end of page

Expected result:
'Show more' link should be displayed after loading first 50 questions
fields.summary: 'Show more' link for next 15 questions does not show in Firefox
500 error on all pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46689].
  {panel}

# Added an answer to https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/168366/create-a-jira-issue-from-a-bamboo-plugin
# Realized it was not an answer to the question
# Tried to delete - confirmed 
# Answer still shows
# Edited the answer
# Tried to delete again
# At some point, I went to question in another window and the answer was gone
fields.summary: Delete answer not showing delete worked
Add stash to Leaderboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46687].
  {panel}

From https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/489/how-do-we-provide-code-blocks-in-these-questions:

I am not sure this code block feature is working as intended across browsers.

I do see that we now have a live preview option, which has been helpful while forming this comment to demonstrate what I see happening here ;-)

For what it's worth, I started trying to enter this comment via Safari v5.1 - and the comment button does not seem to work in Safari. The cancel button does, but comment simply does nothing.
fields.summary: Code block improvements - cross-browser compatibility

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46667].
  {panel}

It looks like this bug has existed since we first forked OSQA.  The simplest way to describe this bug is with an example:

{code}
>>> ## Retrieve a Tag
>>> tag = Tag.objects.get(name='a_tag')
>>> ## Find all questions that are tagged with this Tag
>>> Question.objects.filter_state(deleted=False).filter(tags__id=tag.id)
[<Question: Some Question>]
>>> ## Take the first question in this list as an example
>>> q = Question.objects.filter_state(deleted=False).filter(tags__id=tag.id)[0]
>>> q
<Question: Some Question>
>>> ## Try to access all the tags that this question has by traversing the ManyToManyField defined on the Node model
>>> q.tags.all()
[]
>>> ## An empty list is returned - this is clearly incorrect. We already established that this question has the 'a_tag' tag, as that's how we retrieved it in the first place.
>>> ## The tagnames field is set correctly, though.
>>> q.tagnames
u'a_tag jira another_tag"
{code}

This bug has existed since the beginnings of Answers, and is undoubtedly a root cause behind a lot of weirdness we actually see when trying to build model filters.

This has also resulted in a lot of hacks in the UI where the list of tags against a question is manually built by splitting the 'tagnames' field and retrieving each tag individually.  

The underlying cause of the problem is that we override the Django model Manager for all Node models, and set the {{use_for_related_fields}} setting to {True}.    This is contradictory to the recommendation in the Django docs, which says\[1]:
{quote}
h2. Writing correct Managers for use in automatic Manager instances

As already suggested by the django.contrib.gis example, above, the use_for_related_fields feature is primarily for managers that need to return a custom QuerySet subclass. In providing this functionality in your manager, there are a couple of things to remember.

h3. Do not filter away any results in this type of manager subclass

One reason an automatic manager is used is to access objects that are related to from some other model. In those situations, Django has to be able to see all the objects for the model it is fetching, so that anything which is referred to can be retrieved.

If you override the get_queryset() method and filter out any rows, Django will return incorrect results. Don’t do that. A manager that filters results in get_queryset() is not appropriate for use as an automatic manager.
{quote}

\[1]: https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/dev/topics/db/managers/#manager-types

Once this fix is pushed, there is potentially some low-hanging fruit that could be picked to improve performance in Answers by changing all our tag manipulation code to use the {{tags}} field instead of the {{tagnames}} field.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46664].
  {panel}

A persistent cross site scripting flaw exists in user profiles when the user updates his/her Homepage URL from the Atlassian ID system to contain an XSS vector which executes when inserted as a link, and clicked on by the victim.

1. Visit https://id.atlassian.com/profile/
2. Update your Homepage URL to something like "javascript:alert(document.cookie);" and then submit the changes
3. Return to your profile on answer.atlassian.com and see reflected changes to Homepage URL on profile.

!http://i.imgur.com/Sw5NCRg.png!

I have also emailed security@atlassian.com to inform them of unvalidated input on Atlassian's main profile system (id.atlassian.com) as I feel that by validating that a user indeed puts in a URL, will prevent flaws such as this one.
fields.summary: Persistent Cross Site Scripting Flaw in User Profiles

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46661].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
If you tick the box _Make this a featured topic_ when creating a topic or editing a topic. The topic is not being showed in featured topic. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a topic 
# Tick the box _Make this a featured topic_
 !markasfeaturedtopic.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
* The topic should be shown in the featured topic if _Make this a featured topic_ tick box is checked.

h3. Actual Results
* The topic is not being shown in featured topic.
 !featuredtopic.png|thumbnail! 
 

Affected Version: 2.4.13-D20160201T024702

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46658].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
E-mail notifications are not generated when an answer is submitted on a question that is being watched.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Ask a question
# Submit an answer to the question

h3. Expected Results
A notification that an answer has been submitted is generated.

h3. Actual Results
No notification is generated. Notifications for the initial question submission and comments are generated, just not for answers.

h3. Workaround (for Confluence Server only)
# Uninstall Questions for Confluence
(i) Your data will remain in the database even after the plugin is uninstalled
# [Manually upload|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/UPM/Installing+add-ons#Installingadd-ons-Installingbyfileupload] version [2.4.11 of Questions for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-questions/versions]
(!) Please ensure you create the proper backups of your instance and database, and stage a test prior making changes to production.

fields.summary: Can't get last months data out of tempo.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46652].
  {panel}

h3. IE 8 cannot render Question for Confluence 2.3.4. 

# Cog and help icon are missing
# Cannot save when asking a question
# Drop down menu is not working

h3. Workaround:

Update Internet explorer to latest version 
Question for Confluence 2.3.4 works fine in Firefox browser
fields.summary: Question for Confluence 2.3.4 appeared to be broken in IE 8
